intro: Campanula carpatica, commonly known as the bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Campanula carpatica is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
